reviews.text: Absolutely love this station. Please ignore all negative reviews, they MUST be written by disgruntled employees of lesser stations. Has a pub right next to it. Theres a newly installed bridge too, meaning you no longer have to climb over a fence and run across the track when the crossing is shut. Quite a leafy area too.

Stone Crossing is a quiet station surrounded by trees that help you escape from nearby traffic (and harsh reviewers), as well as having a decent view of the QE2 bridge. Basic facilities, but all you need is here, and good signage to indicate which platform is London bound. The only improvement I could recommend is a clearer electronic timetable. Not quite sure how a previous reviewer managed to get lost?? Would recommend getting to the station with enough time to purchase a ticket, but that only took 2 minutes.
Horrible station with next to no facilities. Hard to even call this an  interchange station of sort, the buses barely stop anywhere near the station too. Pathetic.

Unfortunately Google won't let me give less than 1 star, this station is a nightmare to navigate, took me 5 minutes to get over to the right platform there's no signage and no staff anywere usually its deserted its filthy and has no facilities what so ever and it feels like its in the middle of no were and no bus stops near needs a total renovation
Absolutely hate coming to this station, it feels so deserted, it's a maze to get around and the station is crying for renovation
